byline.contributor: Boryana Dzhambazova reported from Sofia; Kit Gillet from Bucharest, Romania; and Rick Lyman from Warsaw.
byline.original: By BORYANA DZHAMBAZOVA, KIT GILLET and RICK LYMAN

abstract: Bulgarian Ruman Radev, pro-Russian former air force commander with no previous political experience, appears headed for decisive victory in country's presidential election; Bulgarian election and similar results in Moldova illustrate growing nationalism in some areas of world.
lead_paragraph: Rumen Radev, a former air force commander with no previous political experience, seemed headed for a decisive victory in a runoff election.
snippet: Rumen Radev, a former air force commander with no previous political experience, seemed headed for a decisive victory in a runoff election....

headline.main: Pro-Russia Candidate Appears Likely to Win Bulgarian Presidency
headline.print_headline: Pro-Russia Candidate Heads to Victory in Bulgaria
